command.name: create
command.description: Create an image with given size

param.name: initialValue
param.description: initial value to fill matrix with

command.name: createFromData
command.description: Create an image from given raw data

command.name: destroy
command.description: Destroy (i.e.: free memory) an image with given handle

command.name: read
command.description: Read an image from the specified file.

command.name: write
command.description: Write the image with given handle to a file.

command.name: convert
command.description: Convert the image to a different format.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: rgb2gray
command.description: Convert the specified RGB image to gray.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: gray2rgb
command.description: Convert the specified grayscale image to RGB.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: rgb2hsv
command.description: Convert the specified RGB image to HSV.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: hsv2rgb
command.description: Convert the specified HSV image to RGB.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: rgb2hls
command.description: Convert the specified RGB image to HLS.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: hls2rgb
command.description: Convert the specified HLS image to RGB.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: split
command.description: Split a multichannel image.

command.name: merge
command.description: Merge many single channel images into a multichannel image.

command.name: mixChannels
command.description: Mix many single channel images into many multichannel images.

param.name: fromTo
param.description: array of index pairs, i.e. {src1,dst1,src2,dst2,...,srcN,dstN}. see here for details

command.name: get
command.description: Get pixel at specified coordinate.

command.name: set
command.description: Set pixel at specified coordinate.

item.name: area
item.description: resampling using pixel area relation (best for shrinking)

command.name: resize
command.description: Resize an image and return the resized image (original image is not modified).

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: size
command.description: Get the size of an image.

command.name: copy
command.description: Copy a (portion of) image to another image.

param.name: srcOffset
param.description: x, y offset in the source image

param.name: dstOffset
param.description: x, y offset in the destination image

param.name: size
param.description: size (width, height) of the copied region

command.name: clipLine
command.description: Clips the line against the image rectangle.

param.name: p1
param.description: x, y coordinates of first point

param.name: p2
param.description: x, y coordinates of second point

param.name: valid
param.description: false if the line segment is completely outside the image rectangle, otherwise true.

param.name: p1
param.description: x, y coordinates of first point

param.name: p2
param.description: x, y coordinates of second point

command.name: line
command.description: Draw a line segment between (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) points in the image.

param.name: p1
param.description: x, y coordinates of first point

param.name: p2
param.description: x, y coordinates of second point

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: arrowedLine
command.description: Draw a arrow segment starting from (x1,y1) and pointing to (x2,y2).

param.name: p1
param.description: x, y coordinates of first point

param.name: p2
param.description: x, y coordinates of second point

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

param.name: tipLength
param.description: The length of the arrow tip in relation to the arrow length

command.name: polylines
command.description: Draw several polygonal curves.

param.name: points
param.description: curve points, i.e. {c1x1, c1y1, c1x2, c1y2, ..., c1xN1, c1yN1, c2x1, c2y1, ..., c2xN2, c2yN2, ..., cMxNM, cMyNM}

param.name: numPoints
param.description: lengths of curves, i.e. {N1, N2, ..., NM}. the sum of numPoints items must be equal to the number of x,y pairs in points.

param.name: isClosed
param.description: Flag indicating whether the drawn polylines are closed or not. If they are closed, the function draws a line from the last vertex of each curve to its first vertex.

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: rectangle
command.description: Draw a rectangle with corners (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) points in the image.

param.name: p1
param.description: x, y coordinates of top-left corner

param.name: p2
param.description: x, y coordinates of bottom-right corner

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: thickness
param.description: line thickness (negative values means rect is filled)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: circle
command.description: Draw a circle with center (cx,cy) and radius r.

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: thickness
param.description: line thickness (negative values means rect is filled)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: ellipse
command.description: Draw an ellipse with center (cx,cy) and axes (rx,ry) points in the image.

param.name: radius
param.description: radius along x and y axis

param.name: startAngle
param.description: starting angle of the elliptic arc in degrees

param.name: endAngle
param.description: ending angle of the elliptic arc in degrees

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: thickness
param.description: line thickness (negative values means rect is filled)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: fillPoly
command.description: Fills the area bounded by one or more polygon.

param.name: points
param.description: contour points, i.e. {c1x1, c1y1, c1x2, c1y2, ..., c1xN1, c1yN1, c2x1, c2y1, ..., c2xN2, c2yN2, ..., cMxNM, cMyNM}

param.name: numPoints
param.description: lengths of countours, i.e. {N1, N2, ..., NM}. the sum of numPoints items must be equal to the number of x,y pairs in points.

param.name: offset
param.description: x, y offset for all points

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: fillConvexPoly
command.description: Fills a convex polygon.

param.name: points
param.description: polygon vertices, i.e. {x1, y1, x2, y2, ..., xN, yN}

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: shift
param.description: number of fractional bits in the point coordinates

command.name: text
command.description: Drawn a text string.

param.name: pos
param.description: x, y coordinates of the origin (bottom-left corner of the string)

param.name: italic
param.description: if true text will have italic style

param.name: color
param.description: color (red, green, blue values in range 0..255)

param.name: thickness
param.description: thickness used to draw a text

param.name: type
param.description: type of the line (8 for 8-connected line, 4 for 4-connected line, or 16 for antialiased line)

param.name: bottomLeftOrigin
param.description: When true, the image data origin is at the bottom-left corner. Otherwise, it is at the top-left corner

command.name: textSize
command.description: Calculates the width and height of a text string.

param.name: italic
param.description: if true text will have italic style

param.name: thickness
param.description: thickness used to draw a text

param.name: baseline
param.description: y-coordinate of the baseline relative to the bottom-most text point

command.name: abs
command.description: Calculates an absolute value of each pixel.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: absdiff
command.description: Calculates the per-element absolute difference between two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: absdiffK
command.description: Calculates the per-element absolute difference between an array and a scalar.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: add
command.description: Calculates the per-element sum of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: addK
command.description: Calculates the per-element sum of an array and a scalar.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: subtract
command.description: Calculates the per-element difference of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: subtractK
command.description: Calculates the per-element difference of an array and a scalar.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: multiply
command.description: Calculates the per-element product of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: divide
command.description: Calculates the per-element division of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: divideK
command.description: Calculates the per-element division of a scalar by an array.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: compare
command.description: Performs the per-element comparison of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: compareK
command.description: Performs the per-element comparison of an array and scalar value.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

item.name: sum
item.description: the output is the sum of all rows/columns of the matrix.

item.name: avg
item.description: the output is the mean vector of all rows/columns of the matrix.

item.name: max
item.description: the output is the maximum (column/row-wise) of all rows/columns of the matrix.

item.name: min
item.description: the output is the minimum (column/row-wise) of all rows/columns of the matrix.

command.name: reduce
command.description: Reduces a matrix to a vector.

param.name: dim
param.description: dimension index along which the matrix is reduced. 0 means that the matrix is reduced to a single row. 1 means that the matrix is reduced to a single column.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: repeat
command.description: Fills the output array with repeated copies of the input array.

param.name: nx
param.description: how many times the src is repeated along the horizontal axis

param.name: ny
param.description: how many times the src is repeated along the vertical axis

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: flip
command.description: Flips an image around vertical, horizontal, or both axes.

param.name: op
param.description: a flag to specify how to flip the array (see )

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: log
command.description: Calculates the natural logarithm of every array element.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: exp
command.description: Calculates the exponential of every array element.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: pow
command.description: Raises every array element to a power.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: sqrt
command.description: Calculates the square root of every array element.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: addWeighted
command.description: Calculates the weighted sum of two arrays, i.e. DST(i) = SRC1(i)*alpha + SRC2(i)*beta + gamma.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: scaleAdd
command.description: Calculates the sum of a scaled array and another array, i.e. DST(i) = SRC1(i)*scale + SRC2(i).

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: magnitude
command.description: Calculates the magnitude of 2D vectors, i.e. DST(i) = sqrt(SRC1(i)^2, SRC2(i)^2).

command.name: phase
command.description: Calculates the rotation angle of 2D vectors, i.e. DST(i) = atan2(SRC2(i), SRC1(i)).

param.name: angleInDegrees
param.description: when true, the function calculates the angle in degrees, otherwise, they are measured in radians

command.name: polar2cart
command.description: Calculates x and y coordinates of 2D vectors from their magnitude and angle.

param.name: angleInDegrees
param.description: when true, the function calculates the angle in degrees, otherwise, they are measured in radians

command.name: cart2polar
command.description: Calculates magnitude and angle coordinates of 2D vectors from their x and y coordinates.

param.name: angleInDegrees
param.description: when true, the function calculates the angle in degrees, otherwise, they are measured in radians

command.name: bitwiseAnd
command.description: Calculates the per-element bit-wise conjunction of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: bitwiseAndK
command.description: Calculates the per-element bit-wise conjunction of an array and a scalar.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: bitwiseOr
command.description: Calculates the per-element bit-wise disjunction of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: bitwiseOrK
command.description: Calculates the per-element bit-wise disjunction of an array and a scalar.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: bitwiseXor
command.description: Calculates the per-element bit-wise exclusive-or of two arrays.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: bitwiseXorK
command.description: Calculates the per-element bit-wise exclusive-or of an array and a scalar.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: bitwiseNot
command.description: Inverts every bit of an array.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: distanceTransform
command.description: Calculates the distance to the closest zero pixel for each pixel of the source image.

param.name: inPlace
param.description: if true, the original immage will be converted in place. otherwise, the original image will not be modified and a new image is returned.

command.name: handles
command.description: Get all the active handles.

command.name: writeToVisionSensor
command.description: Write image to vision sensor. Make sure the vision sensor is flagged as external input.

command.name: readFromVisionSensor
command.description: Read image from vision sensor.

param.name: handle
param.description: handle to existing image, or -1 to create and return a new image

param.name: handle
param.description: handle to new image (or existing image if given)

command.name: openVideoCapture
command.description: Open video capture device.

command.name: closeVideoCapture
command.description: Close video capture device.

command.name: readFromVideoCapture
command.description: Read frame from video capture device.

param.name: handle
param.description: handle to existing image, or -1 to create and return a new image

param.name: handle
param.description: handle to new image (or existing image if given)
